intro: Cyphostemma libenii, commonly known as the Ethiopian moonvine, is a climbing plant native to the highlands of Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in scrublands and woodlands. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
